item.title: 3_RA : LEARN THE ART AND PUT IT ASIDE
item.description: Table of Contents THE BASIC OF GDI+ THE GRAFIC OBJECT SIMPLE LINE DRAWINGS - Credits THE BASIC OF GDI+ n graphical user interfaces such as Microsoft Windows, drawing on the screen is an important task. Everything displayed on the screen is based on simple drawing operations. Often, environments such as Visual Basic abstract those drawing operations away from the developer. However, the same drawing operations still take place under the hood.
item.content:
Table of Contents

  • THE BASIC OF GDI+
  • THE GRAFIC OBJECT
  • SIMPLE LINE DRAWINGS - Credits

THE BASIC OF GDI+

n graphical user interfaces such as Microsoft Windows, drawing on the screen is an important task.

Everything displayed on the screen is based on simple drawing operations. Often, environments such as Visual Basic abstract those drawing operations away from the developer. However, the same drawing operations still take place under the hood. In Visual Studio .NET, developers have easy access to that drawing functionality whenever they need it through a technology called GDI+. Using GDI+, developers can easily perform drawing operations such as generating graphs or building custom controls.

Whenever you create a Windows Forms (WinForms) application .NET uses(and includes) GDI+ by default. The System.Drawing namespace contains all GDI+ functionality (as well as a few sub-namespaces). GDI+ provides all the basic drawing features, such as drawing lines, curves, circles, ellipses, strings, bitmaps, and more. GDI+ also gives developers the ability to fill areas with colors, patterns, and textures. This article will explain some of the basic drawing mechanisms that GDI+ provides.

THE GRAFIC OBJECT

All GDI+ drawing is done using a Graphics object. This object has a large number of methods that encapsulate drawing operations on a drawing “canvas.” GDI+ supports a number of drawing canvases including: windows, bitmaps, and printer pages. Depending on the type of drawing canvas, the Graphics object is created or retrieved in a number of different ways. If you want to modify the contents of a bitmap file you would create a Bitmap canvas using the FromImage() method. This article will focus on one type of canvas: the window.

Drawing in a WinForms-form is a somewhat peculiar task, because it is not enough to draw the graphic once. Instead, the “drawing” may have to be “refreshed” (re-drawn) whenever a window requires repainting. Repainting can happen whenever a user resizes a window or one window overlaps another window and then something brings the overlapped windows to the front.

So how do you know when to start drawing? The easiest way is to listen to the Paint event that is fired by every window (or control for that matter). The Paint event is a very good choice for drawing-logic because it fires whenever you need to refresh the display, and because part of the Paint event arguments (parameters) is a handle to the Graphics object. You can access the Graphics object via the following C# code:

private void Form1_Paint(object sender,
System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs e)
{
Graphics g = e.Graphics;
}

SIMPLE LINE DRAWINGS

A fundamental task performed by the graphics-object, is drawing lines and curves. You can use a number of methods for this purpose.

In GDI+, unlike in regular (older) GDI, drawing lines and filling areas are two entirely different operations.

When you draw lines, you must consider a number of fundamental things. For example, you need to choose what kind of line to draw.. Do you want a straight line, or a curve? Do you want a simple, single line, or do you want to draw a complex line composed out of many segments? Maybe you want to draw a closed shape that forms a completely enclosed area with an identical start and end point (such as a circle, rectangle, or polygon)? Depending on the desired shape of the line, different methods are available to generate them.

Less obvious than the position and shape of the line, are the parameters for a line. You might ask, “What parameters can I specify for a line?” You can specify the following parameters: attributes such as color and thickness, start and end-points, and the shape of the end of a line such as whether the line ends in a rounded or square “head” or ends in an arrow.

In GDI+, lines are represented by Pen objects. Pens encapsulate all the attributes described above. GDI+ provides a number of default Pen objects, such as pens of different colors. The following code demonstrated drawing a simple straight line using different pens.

g.DrawLine(Pens.Red,10,10,200,100)
g.DrawLine(Pens.Green,10,30,200, 120)
g.DrawLine(Pens.Blue,10,50,200,140)

If you want to adjust the thickness of the used pen, you need to instantiate a custom pen object. This example generates a 5-pixel thick red pen and uses it to draw another line:

g.DrawLine( _   New Pen(Color.Red, 5), _   10, 100, 200, 190)

If you play with the DrawLine() method a bit, you will discover that it has a large number of overloads, though the result of these overloads is the same. You can just take different paths to your destination. I encourage you to experiment with the different options.

For instance, you can draw circles and ellipses:

g.DrawEllipse(Pens.Red, _   10, 10, 150, 80)

Similarly, you can draw rectangles with this code:

g.DrawRectangle(Pens.Green, _   20, 100, 120, 60)
Credits

I want to thank and mention some resources that I found particularly helpful in the writing of this post:

  • https://www.codemag.com/article/0305031

item.title: 4_R
item.description: Table of Contents INTRO WHAT ARE MARGINAL DISTRIBUTION? WHAT ARE JOINT FREQUENCY? WHAT ARE CONDITIONAL DISTRIBUTION? BAYES THEOREM: WHAT IS STATISTICAL INDEPENDENCE? Note - Credits INTRO in this post we will talk about what are marginal, joint and conditional distributions. later we will discuss how to use Bayes' theorem using relative frequencies. Finally, we will explain the concept of statistical independence and why, in case of independence, the relative joint frequencies are equal to the products of the corresponding marginal frequencies.
item.content:
Table of Contents

  • INTRO
  • WHAT ARE MARGINAL DISTRIBUTION?
  • WHAT ARE JOINT FREQUENCY?
  • WHAT ARE CONDITIONAL DISTRIBUTION?
  • BAYES THEOREM:
  • WHAT IS STATISTICAL INDEPENDENCE?
    • Note - Credits

INTRO

in this post we will talk about what are marginal, joint and conditional distributions. later we will discuss how to use Bayes' theorem using relative frequencies. Finally, we will explain the concept of statistical independence and why, in case of independence, the relative joint frequencies are equal to the products of the corresponding marginal frequencies. So, let’s get started!

WHAT ARE MARGINAL DISTRIBUTION?

The frequency of an category occurring (Freq(X)), it may be thought of as an unconditional frequency. It is not conditioned on another category. Example: the frequency that a card drawn is red (Freq(red) = 0.5). Another example could be: the frequency that a card drawn is a 4 (Freq(four)=1/13).

$$ Freq(X) = \frac{\text{count of statistical units that fall into category X}}{\text{total count of statistical units}}$$

WHAT ARE JOINT FREQUENCY?

Example: the frequency that a card is a four and red =Freq(four and red) = 2/52=1/26. (There are two red fours in a deck of 52, the 4 of hearts and the 4 of diamonds).

$$ Freq(X \cap Y) = \frac{\text{counts of statistical units falling into categories X and Y}}{\text{total count of statistical units}}$$

WHAT ARE CONDITIONAL DISTRIBUTION?

Freq(X | Y) is the frequency of a statistical units falling into category X, given that it already falls into category Y. Example: given that you drew a red card, what’s the frequency that it’s a four (Freq(four|red))=2/26=1/13. So out of the 26 red cards (given a red card), there are two fours so 2/26=1/13.

$$ Freq(X|Y) = \frac{Freq(X \cap Y)}{Freq(Y)}$$

BAYES THEOREM:

Bayes’ theorem is an equation that allows us to manipulate conditional frequencies. For two categories, X and Y, Bayes’ theorem lets us to go from Freq(Y|X) to Freq(X|Y) if we know the marginal probabilities of the outcomes of Xand the frequency of Y, given the outcomes of X. Here is the equation for Bayes’ theorem for two categorys with two possible outcome (X and not Y). Note the inter-steps that show how the final result is reached. It follows just from the conditional distribution equation, where we substitute Freq(X ∩Y) with Freq(Y|X)Freq(X).

$$ Freq(X|Y) = \frac{Freq(X \cap Y)}{Freq(Y)} = \frac{Freq(Y|X)Freq(X)}{Freq(Y)}$$

WHAT IS STATISTICAL INDEPENDENCE?

$$ Pr(A|B) = Pr(A)$$

we can say that A, is statistically independent of B when :

whether B happens makes no difference to how often A happens.

If this holds, though, then B is also independent of A :

$$ Pr(B|A) = \frac{Pr(A \cap B)}{Pr(A)} = \frac{Pr(A)Pr(B)}{Pr(A)} = Pr(B)$$

so we can just say “A and B are independent”.

Note

Statistically independent is not the same as mutually exclusive: if A and B are mutually exclusive, then they can’t be independent, unless one of them is probability 0 to start with: $$ Pr(A \cap B) = 0 = Pr(A)Pr(B)$$

Credits

I want to thank and mention some resources that I found particularly helpful in the writing of this post:

  • https://sites.nicholas.duke.edu/statsreview/jmc/
  • https://www.stat.cmu.edu/~cshalizi/36-220/lecture-5.pdf

item.title: 2_RA : 50 SHADES OF DATA
item.description: Table of Contents WHAT IS DATA VISUALIZATION? IS IT IMPORTANT TO CHOOSE A SPECIFIC TYPE OF CHART TO VISUALIZE DATA? BUT WHY? INFORM COMPARE CHANGE ORGANIZE RELATIONSHIPS - Credits WHAT IS DATA VISUALIZATION? The human mind is very receptive to visual information. That’s why data visualization is a powerful tool for communication. Data visualization is the visual presentation of data or information. The goal of data visualization is to communicate data or information clearly and effectively to readers.
item.content:
Table of Contents

  • WHAT IS DATA VISUALIZATION?
  • IS IT IMPORTANT TO CHOOSE A SPECIFIC TYPE OF CHART TO VISUALIZE DATA?
    • BUT WHY?
    • INFORM
    • COMPARE
    • CHANGE
    • ORGANIZE
    • RELATIONSHIPS - Credits

WHAT IS DATA VISUALIZATION?

The human mind is very receptive to visual information. That’s why data visualization is a powerful tool for communication.

Data visualization is the visual presentation of data or information. The goal of data visualization is to communicate data or information clearly and effectively to readers. Typically, data is visualized in the form of a chart, infographic, diagram or map. Charts use visual symbols like line, bars, dots, slices, and icons to represent data points.

IS IT IMPORTANT TO CHOOSE A SPECIFIC TYPE OF CHART TO VISUALIZE DATA?

Short answer: yes.

BUT WHY?

Well, we can say that some charts are better suited for some purposes than others and help us to better communicate what we want, let’s see some examples:

INFORM

You want to convey a single important data point.

  • Single big number
  • Donut chart
  • Pictograph

COMPARE

You want to compare categories or show composition.

  • Bar chart
  • Bubble chart
  • Pie chart
  • Stacked bar chart
  • Bubble cloud
  • Treemap
  • Word Cloud

CHANGE

You want to show change over time by location.

  • Line chart
  • Area chart
  • Timeline
  • Map chart

ORGANIZE

You want to show groupings,rankings, or process.

  • List
  • Flow chart
  • Venn diagram
  • Mind map
  • Pyramid
  • Table

RELATIONSHIPS

You want to reveal relationships correlations or distributions.

  • Scatter plot
  • Histogram
  • Multi-Series chart
Credits

I want to thank and mention some resources that I found particularly helpful in the writing of this post:

  • https://venngage.com/blog/data-visualization/

item.title: 5_A : 'SAY WHAT AGAIN'
item.description: Table of Contents Intro Live Demo Result C# Code: VB.NET Code: Download source code: Intro in this task, I’ve realized a program that reads as input a text file (.txt), shows its content and computes the World Cloud.In the example shown in the video I used one of the most famous dialogues from the movie Pulp Fiction (one of my favorites). Live Demo here, you can see my program in action Result C# Code: using System; using System.
item.content:
Table of Contents

  • Intro
  • Live Demo
  • Result
  • C# Code:
  • VB.NET Code:
  • Download source code:

Intro

in this task, I’ve realized a program that reads as input a text file (.txt), shows its content and computes the World Cloud.In the example shown in the video I used one of the most famous dialogues from the movie Pulp Fiction (one of my favorites).

Live Demo

here, you can see my program in action

Result

C# Code:

using System;
using System.Collections;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using System.IO;
using Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices; // Install-Package Microsoft.VisualBasic
using WordCloud;

public partial class Form1
{
    public Form1()
    {
        base.Load += Form1_Load;
    }

    private object text;
    private Dictionary<string, int> words = new Dictionary<string, int>();

    private void Form1_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        this.RichTextBox1.EnableAutoDragDrop = true;
    }

    private void RichTextBox1_DragDrop(object sender, Global.System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs e)
    {
        e.Effect = DragDropEffects.None;
        this.RichTextBox1.Clear();
        string[] files = (string[])e.Data.GetData(DataFormats.FileDrop);
        foreach (var path in files)
            ProcessaFile(path);
    }

    private void RichTextBox1_DragEnter(object sender, Global.System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs e)
    {
        if (e.Data.GetDataPresent(DataFormats.FileDrop))
        {
            e.Effect = DragDropEffects.Copy;
        }
    }

    public void ProcessaFile(string path)
    {
        this.RichTextBox1.AppendText(path + Environment.NewLine);
        Button2.Enabled = true;
    }

    private void ButtonGetFile_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        var ofd = new OpenFileDialog();
        ofd.ShowDialog();
        if (ofd.FileName is object)
        {
            this.RichTextBox1.Text = ofd.FileName;
            Button2.Enabled = true;
        }
    }

    private void Button2_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        this.RichTextBox2.Clear();
        string path = this.RichTextBox1.Text;
        var sr = new StreamReader(path);
        do
        {
            string line = sr.ReadLine();
            if (sr.EndOfStream)
            {
                break;
            }

            this.RichTextBox2.AppendText(line + Environment.NewLine);
        }
        while (true);
        text = File.ReadAllText(path).Replace(",", "").ToLower();
        var wordsInFile = text.Split(' ');
        foreach (var word in (IEnumerable)wordsInFile)
        {
            if (words.ContainsKey(Conversions.ToString(word)))
            {
                words[Conversions.ToString(word)] += 1;
            }
            else
            {
                words[Conversions.ToString(word)] = 1;
            }
        }

        this.RichTextBox2.AppendText(Environment.NewLine + Environment.NewLine);
        this.RichTextBox2.AppendText("FREQUENCY OF WORDS IN TEXT" + Environment.NewLine);
        this.RichTextBox2.AppendText("___________________________________" + Environment.NewLine);
        this.RichTextBox2.AppendText("Word".PadRight(30) + "Frequency".PadRight(30) + Environment.NewLine);
        Button3.Enabled = true;
    }

    private void Button3_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        var wordss = new List<string>();
        var frequency = new List<int>();
        foreach (KeyValuePair<string, int> kvp in words)
        {
            wordss.Add(kvp.Key.ToString());
            frequency.Add(kvp.Value);
            this.RichTextBox2.AppendText(kvp.Key.ToString().PadRight(30) + " " + kvp.Value.ToString().PadRight(30) + Environment.NewLine);
        }

        var wc = new WordCloud.WordCloud(480, 360, true);
        wc.Draw(wordss, frequency).Save(@"C:\Users\Luca\Desktop\WordCloud.JPG");
        string imagePath = @"C:\Users\Luca\Desktop\WordCloud.JPG";
        this.PictureBox1.Image = new Bitmap(imagePath);
    }
}

VB.NET Code:

Imports System.IO
Imports WordCloud

Public Class Form1
    Dim text
    Dim words As Dictionary(Of String, Integer) = New Dictionary(Of String, Integer)()
    Private Sub Form1_Load(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load
        Me.RichTextBox1.EnableAutoDragDrop = True
    End Sub
    Private Sub RichTextBox1_DragDrop(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs) Handles RichTextBox1.DragDrop
        e.Effect = DragDropEffects.None

        Me.RichTextBox1.Clear()
        Dim files() As String = CType(e.Data.GetData(DataFormats.FileDrop), String())

        For Each path In files
            Me.ProcessaFile(path)
        Next
    End Sub
    Private Sub RichTextBox1_DragEnter(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs) Handles RichTextBox1.DragEnter
        If e.Data.GetDataPresent(DataFormats.FileDrop) Then
            e.Effect = DragDropEffects.Copy
        End If
    End Sub
    Sub ProcessaFile(path As String)
        Me.RichTextBox1.AppendText(path & Environment.NewLine)
        Button2.Enabled = True
    End Sub
    Private Sub ButtonGetFile_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click
        Dim ofd As New OpenFileDialog
        ofd.ShowDialog()

        If ofd.FileName IsNot Nothing Then
            Me.RichTextBox1.Text = ofd.FileName
            Button2.Enabled = True
        End If
    End Sub
    Private Sub Button2_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button2.Click
        Me.RichTextBox2.Clear()
        Dim path As String = Me.RichTextBox1.Text
        Dim sr As New StreamReader(path)

        Do
            Dim line As String = sr.ReadLine
            If sr.EndOfStream Then
                Exit Do
            End If
            Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText(line & Environment.NewLine)
        Loop

        text = File.ReadAllText(path).Replace(",", "").ToLower()
        Dim wordsInFile = text.Split(" "c)

        For Each word In wordsInFile
            If words.ContainsKey(word) Then
                words(word) += 1
            Else
                words(word) = 1
            End If
        Next
        Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText(Environment.NewLine & Environment.NewLine)
        Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText("FREQUENCY OF WORDS IN TEXT" & Environment.NewLine)
        Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText("___________________________________" & Environment.NewLine)
        Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText("Word".PadRight(30) & "Frequency".PadRight(30) & Environment.NewLine)
        Button3.Enabled = True
    End Sub

    Private Sub Button3_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button3.Click
        Dim wordss As New List(Of String)
        Dim frequency As New List(Of Integer)
        For Each kvp As KeyValuePair(Of String, Integer) In words
            wordss.Add(kvp.Key.ToString())
            frequency.Add(kvp.Value)
            Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText(kvp.Key.ToString().PadRight(30) & " " & kvp.Value.ToString().PadRight(30) & Environment.NewLine)
        Next
        Dim wc As New WordCloud.WordCloud(480, 360, True)
        wc.Draw(wordss, frequency).Save("C:\Users\Luca\Desktop\WordCloud.JPG")
        Dim imagePath As String = "C:\Users\Luca\Desktop\WordCloud.JPG"
        Me.PictureBox1.Image = New Bitmap(imagePath)
    End Sub
End Class

Download source code:

click here 📥

item.title: 4_A : RAMEN AND STATISTICS
item.description: Table of Contents Intro Live Demo C# Code: VB.NET Code: Download source code: Intro In this task I have created a program that takes as input a CSV file regarding some Ramen stores around the world. It is possible to visualize all the data in the file and some interesting statistics are computed, both in the case of one variable and in the case of two variables. If you want to try the program, besides downloading the source code at the end of the page, clicking here you will find the link to download the CSV file.
item.content:
Table of Contents

  • Intro
  • Live Demo
  • C# Code:
  • VB.NET Code:
  • Download source code:

Intro

In this task I have created a program that takes as input a CSV file regarding some Ramen stores around the world. It is possible to visualize all the data in the file and some interesting statistics are computed, both in the case of one variable and in the case of two variables. If you want to try the program, besides downloading the source code at the end of the page, clicking here you will find the link to download the CSV file.

Live Demo

here, you can see my program in action

C# Code:

using System;
using System.Collections.Generic;
using Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices; // Install-Package Microsoft.VisualBasic
using Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileIO; // Install-Package Microsoft.VisualBasic

public partial class Form1
{
    public Form1()
    {
        base.Load += Form1_Load;
    }

    private List<Ramen> listOfValues = new List<Ramen>();

    private void Form1_Load(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        this.RichTextBox1.EnableAutoDragDrop = true;
    }

    private void RichTextBox1_DragDrop(object sender, Global.System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs e)
    {
        e.Effect = DragDropEffects.None;
        this.RichTextBox1.Clear();
        string[] files = (string[])e.Data.GetData(DataFormats.FileDrop);
        foreach (var path in files)
            ProcessaFile(path);
    }

    private void RichTextBox1_DragEnter(object sender, Global.System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs e)
    {
        if (e.Data.GetDataPresent(DataFormats.FileDrop))
        {
            e.Effect = DragDropEffects.Copy;
        }
    }

    public void ProcessaFile(string path)
    {
        this.RichTextBox1.AppendText(path + Environment.NewLine);
    }

    private void Button1_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        var tfp = new TextFieldParser(this.RichTextBox1.Text.Trim);
        tfp.Delimiters = new string[] { "," };
        tfp.TextFieldType = FieldType.Delimited;
        string desc = tfp.ReadLine();
        this.RichTextBox2.AppendText(desc + Environment.NewLine);
        this.RichTextBox2.AppendText("__________________________________________________________" + Environment.NewLine + Environment.NewLine);
        while (tfp.EndOfData == false)
        {
            var fields = tfp.ReadFields();
            var r = new Ramen();
            r.numberOfReview = Conversions.ToInteger(fields[0]);
            r.brand = fields[1];
            r.variety = fields[2];
            r.style = fields[3];
            if (fields[4] is object)
            {
                r.country = fields[4];
            }

            if (string.Equals(fields[5], "Unrated"))
            {
                r.stars = (int)Math.Round(0.0);
            }
            else
            {
                r.stars = Conversions.ToInteger(fields[5]);
                // Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText(fields(5) & Environment.NewLine)
            }

            this.RichTextBox2.AppendText(string.Format("{0} - {1} - {2} - {3} - {4} - {5} ", r.numberOfReview, r.brand, r.variety, r.style, r.country, r.stars) + Environment.NewLine);
            if (r is object)
            {
                listOfValues.Add(r);
            }
        }

        Button3.Enabled = true;
    }

    private void ButtonGetFile_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        var ofd = new OpenFileDialog();
        ofd.ShowDialog();
        if (ofd.FileName is object)
        {
            this.RichTextBox1.Text = ofd.FileName;
        }
    }

    private void Button3_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
    {
        this.RichTextBox3.AppendText("ARITHMETIC MEAN OF # OF REVIEWS " + Environment.NewLine);
        this.RichTextBox3.AppendText("________________________________" + Environment.NewLine);
        int totalNumber = 2580;
        int sum = 0;
        foreach (var ramen in listOfValues)
            sum += ramen.numberOfReview;
        double average = Math.Round(sum / (double)(totalNumber - 1), 2);
        this.RichTextBox3.AppendText(average + Environment.NewLine);
        this.RichTextBox3.AppendText("DISTRIBUTION OF RAMEN SHOPS IN COUNTRIES" + Environment.NewLine);
        this.RichTextBox3.AppendText("________________________________" + Environment.NewLine);
        var frequencyDist = new Dictionary<string, Frequencies>();
        foreach (Ramen r in listOfValues)
        {
            if (frequencyDist.ContainsKey(r.country))
            {
                frequencyDist[r.country].count += 1m;
            }
            else
            {
                frequencyDist.Add(r.country, new Frequencies(1m));
            }

            frequencyDist[r.country].relativeFreq = Math.Round(frequencyDist[r.country].count / (totalNumber - 1), 2);
            frequencyDist[r.country].precentage = frequencyDist[r.country].relativeFreq * 100m;
        }

        this.RichTextBox3.AppendText("Country ".PadRight(12) + "Frequency ".PadRight(12) + "RFreq ".PadRight(12) + "Percentage ".PadRight(12) + Environment.NewLine);
        foreach (KeyValuePair<string, Frequencies> kvp in frequencyDist)
            this.RichTextBox3.AppendText(kvp.Key.ToString().PadRight(12) + " " + kvp.Value.count.ToString().PadRight(12) + " " + kvp.Value.relativeFreq.ToString().PadRight(12) + " " + kvp.Value.precentage.ToString() + " %" + Environment.NewLine);
        this.RichTextBox3.AppendText(Environment.NewLine + "DISTRIBUTION OF RATINGS OF RAMEN SHOPS IN JAPAN" + Environment.NewLine);
        this.RichTextBox3.AppendText("________________________________" + Environment.NewLine);
        var ratingsDist = new Dictionary<int, Frequencies>();
        ratingsDist.Add(5, new Frequencies(0m));
        ratingsDist.Add(4, new Frequencies(0m));
        ratingsDist.Add(3, new Frequencies(0m));
        ratingsDist.Add(2, new Frequencies(0m));
        ratingsDist.Add(1, new Frequencies(0m));
        int totalNum = 0;
        foreach (Ramen r in listOfValues)
        {
            if (r.country.Equals("Japan"))
            {
                if (r.stars == 5)
                {
                    ratingsDist[5].count += 1m;
                    totalNum += 1;
                }

                if (r.stars == 4)
                {
                    ratingsDist[4].count += 1m;
                    totalNum += 1;
                }

                if (r.stars == 3)
                {
                    ratingsDist[3].count += 1m;
                    totalNum += 1;
                }

                if (r.stars == 2)
                {
                    ratingsDist[2].count += 1m;
                    totalNum += 1;
                }

                if (r.stars == 1)
                {
                    ratingsDist[1].count += 1m;
                    totalNum += 1;
                }
            }
        }

        ratingsDist[5].relativeFreq = Math.Round(ratingsDist[5].count / (totalNum - 1), 2);
        ratingsDist[5].precentage = ratingsDist[5].relativeFreq * 100m;
        ratingsDist[4].relativeFreq = Math.Round(ratingsDist[4].count / (totalNum - 1), 2);
        ratingsDist[4].precentage = ratingsDist[4].relativeFreq * 100m;
        ratingsDist[3].relativeFreq = Math.Round(ratingsDist[3].count / (totalNum - 1), 2);
        ratingsDist[3].precentage = ratingsDist[3].relativeFreq * 100m;
        ratingsDist[2].relativeFreq = Math.Round(ratingsDist[2].count / (totalNum - 1), 2);
        ratingsDist[2].precentage = ratingsDist[2].relativeFreq * 100m;
        ratingsDist[1].relativeFreq = Math.Round(ratingsDist[1].count / (totalNum - 1), 2);
        ratingsDist[1].precentage = ratingsDist[1].relativeFreq * 100m;
        this.RichTextBox3.AppendText("Rating ".PadRight(12) + "Frequency ".PadRight(12) + "RFreq ".PadRight(12) + "Percentage ".PadRight(12) + Environment.NewLine);
        foreach (KeyValuePair<int, Frequencies> kvp in ratingsDist)
            this.RichTextBox3.AppendText(kvp.Key.ToString().PadRight(12) + " " + kvp.Value.count.ToString().PadRight(12) + " " + kvp.Value.relativeFreq.ToString().PadRight(12) + " " + kvp.Value.precentage.ToString() + " %" + Environment.NewLine);
    }
}

public partial class Ramen
{
    public string brand, variety, style, country;
    public int numberOfReview;
    public int stars;
}

public partial class Frequencies
{
    public decimal count;
    public decimal relativeFreq;
    public decimal precentage;

    public Frequencies(decimal c)
    {
        count = c;
    }

    public Frequencies(decimal c, decimal rf, decimal p)
    {
        count = c;
        relativeFreq = rf;
        precentage = p;
    }
}

VB.NET Code:

Imports System.IO
Imports Microsoft.VisualBasic.FileIO

Public Class Form1

    Dim listOfValues As New List(Of Ramen)
    Private Sub Form1_Load(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load
        Me.RichTextBox1.EnableAutoDragDrop = True
    End Sub
    Private Sub RichTextBox1_DragDrop(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs) Handles RichTextBox1.DragDrop
        e.Effect = DragDropEffects.None

        Me.RichTextBox1.Clear()
        Dim files() As String = CType(e.Data.GetData(DataFormats.FileDrop), String())

        For Each path In files
            Me.ProcessaFile(path)
        Next
    End Sub
    Private Sub RichTextBox1_DragEnter(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.Forms.DragEventArgs) Handles RichTextBox1.DragEnter
        If e.Data.GetDataPresent(DataFormats.FileDrop) Then
            e.Effect = DragDropEffects.Copy
        End If
    End Sub
    Sub ProcessaFile(path As String)
        Me.RichTextBox1.AppendText(path & Environment.NewLine)
    End Sub
    Private Sub Button1_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button1.Click

        Dim tfp As New TextFieldParser(Me.RichTextBox1.Text.Trim)
        tfp.Delimiters = New String() {","}
        tfp.TextFieldType = FieldType.Delimited

        Dim desc As String = tfp.ReadLine()
        Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText(desc & Environment.NewLine)
        Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText("__________________________________________________________" & Environment.NewLine & Environment.NewLine)


        While tfp.EndOfData = False
            Dim fields = tfp.ReadFields()
            Dim r As New Ramen()
            r.numberOfReview = fields(0)
            r.brand = fields(1)
            r.variety = fields(2)
            r.style = fields(3)
            If fields(4) IsNot Nothing Then
                r.country = fields(4)
            End If
            If String.Equals(fields(5), "Unrated") Then
                r.stars = 0.0
            Else
                r.stars = fields(5)
                'Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText(fields(5) & Environment.NewLine)
            End If
            Me.RichTextBox2.AppendText(String.Format("{0} - {1} - {2} - {3} - {4} - {5} ", r.numberOfReview, r.brand, r.variety, r.style, r.country, r.stars) & Environment.NewLine)

            If r IsNot Nothing Then
                listOfValues.Add(r)
            End If

        End While
        Button3.Enabled = True
    End Sub
    Private Sub ButtonGetFile_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button2.Click
        Dim ofd As New OpenFileDialog
        ofd.ShowDialog()

        If ofd.FileName IsNot Nothing Then
            Me.RichTextBox1.Text = ofd.FileName
        End If
    End Sub

    Private Sub Button3_Click(sender As Object, e As EventArgs) Handles Button3.Click
        Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText("ARITHMETIC MEAN OF # OF REVIEWS " & Environment.NewLine)
        Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText("________________________________" & Environment.NewLine)
        Dim totalNumber As Integer = 2580
        Dim sum As Integer = 0
        For Each ramen In listOfValues
            sum += ramen.numberOfReview
        Next
        Dim average As Double = Math.Round(sum / (totalNumber - 1), 2)
        Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText(average & Environment.NewLine)
        Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText("DISTRIBUTION OF RAMEN SHOPS IN COUNTRIES" & Environment.NewLine)
        Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText("________________________________" & Environment.NewLine)
        Dim frequencyDist As Dictionary(Of String, Frequencies) = New Dictionary(Of String, Frequencies)()
        For Each r As Ramen In listOfValues

            If frequencyDist.ContainsKey(r.country) Then
                frequencyDist(r.country).count += 1
            Else
                frequencyDist.Add(r.country, New Frequencies(1))
            End If

            frequencyDist(r.country).relativeFreq = Math.Round(frequencyDist(r.country).count / (totalNumber - 1), 2)
            frequencyDist(r.country).precentage = frequencyDist(r.country).relativeFreq * 100
        Next
        Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText("Country ".PadRight(12) & "Frequency ".PadRight(12) & "RFreq ".PadRight(12) & "Percentage ".PadRight(12) & Environment.NewLine)
        For Each kvp As KeyValuePair(Of String, Frequencies) In frequencyDist
            Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText(kvp.Key.ToString().PadRight(12) & " " & kvp.Value.count.ToString().PadRight(12) & " " & kvp.Value.relativeFreq.ToString().PadRight(12) & " " & kvp.Value.precentage.ToString() & " %" & Environment.NewLine)
        Next
        Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText(Environment.NewLine & "DISTRIBUTION OF RATINGS OF RAMEN SHOPS IN JAPAN" & Environment.NewLine)
        Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText("________________________________" & Environment.NewLine)
        Dim ratingsDist As Dictionary(Of Integer, Frequencies) = New Dictionary(Of Integer, Frequencies)()
        ratingsDist.Add(5, New Frequencies(0))
        ratingsDist.Add(4, New Frequencies(0))
        ratingsDist.Add(3, New Frequencies(0))
        ratingsDist.Add(2, New Frequencies(0))
        ratingsDist.Add(1, New Frequencies(0))
        Dim totalNum = 0
        For Each r As Ramen In listOfValues
            If r.country.Equals("Japan") Then
                If r.stars = 5 Then
                    ratingsDist(5).count += 1
                    totalNum += 1
                End If
                If r.stars = 4 Then
                    ratingsDist(4).count += 1
                    totalNum += 1
                End If
                If r.stars = 3 Then
                    ratingsDist(3).count += 1
                    totalNum += 1
                End If
                If r.stars = 2 Then
                    ratingsDist(2).count += 1
                    totalNum += 1
                End If
                If r.stars = 1 Then
                    ratingsDist(1).count += 1
                    totalNum += 1
                End If
            End If
        Next
        ratingsDist(5).relativeFreq = Math.Round(ratingsDist(5).count / (totalNum - 1), 2)
        ratingsDist(5).precentage = ratingsDist(5).relativeFreq * 100
        ratingsDist(4).relativeFreq = Math.Round(ratingsDist(4).count / (totalNum - 1), 2)
        ratingsDist(4).precentage = ratingsDist(4).relativeFreq * 100
        ratingsDist(3).relativeFreq = Math.Round(ratingsDist(3).count / (totalNum - 1), 2)
        ratingsDist(3).precentage = ratingsDist(3).relativeFreq * 100
        ratingsDist(2).relativeFreq = Math.Round(ratingsDist(2).count / (totalNum - 1), 2)
        ratingsDist(2).precentage = ratingsDist(2).relativeFreq * 100
        ratingsDist(1).relativeFreq = Math.Round(ratingsDist(1).count / (totalNum - 1), 2)
        ratingsDist(1).precentage = ratingsDist(1).relativeFreq * 100
        Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText("Rating ".PadRight(12) & "Frequency ".PadRight(12) & "RFreq ".PadRight(12) & "Percentage ".PadRight(12) & Environment.NewLine)
        For Each kvp As KeyValuePair(Of Integer, Frequencies) In ratingsDist
            Me.RichTextBox3.AppendText(kvp.Key.ToString().PadRight(12) & " " & kvp.Value.count.ToString().PadRight(12) & " " & kvp.Value.relativeFreq.ToString().PadRight(12) & " " & kvp.Value.precentage.ToString() & " %" & Environment.NewLine)
        Next

    End Sub
End Class
Public Class Ramen
    Public brand, variety, style, country As String
    Public numberOfReview As Integer
    Public stars As Integer
End Class
Public Class Frequencies
    Public count As Decimal
    Public relativeFreq As Decimal
    Public precentage As Decimal

    Public Sub New(ByVal c As Decimal)
        count = c
    End Sub

    Public Sub New(ByVal c As Decimal, ByVal rf As Decimal, ByVal p As Decimal)
        count = c
        relativeFreq = rf
        precentage = p
    End Sub
End Class
